intro: Achyrophorus laevigatus, commonly known as the smooth achyrophorus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its smooth, glabrous stems and foliage contribute to its distinctive botanical appearance.
